snippet: Players’ families will be reimbursed for some travel expenses for the College Football Playoff’s title game and the men’s and women’s basketball Final Fours, the N.C.A.A. said.
abstract: NCAA grants waiver allowing College Football Playoff to reimburse players' parents or legal guardians for travel, hotels and meals when traveling to championship game between Ohio State and Oregon; pilot program will also extend to semifinals and finals of the NCAA college basketball tournament; decision closely follows complaint issued by Ohio State coach Urban Meyer.
lead_paragraph: Players’ families will be reimbursed for some travel expenses for the College Football Playoff’s title game and the men’s and women’s basketball Final Fours, the N.C.A.A. said.

headline.main: N.C.A.A. to Allow Family Travel Aid for Top Title Games
headline.print_headline: N.C.A.A. to Allow Family Travel Aid for Top Title Games
